oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mardi Gras Contract - French
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mardi Gras; Mystic Memphi; business;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Contract between David P. Hadden representing the Society of Memphi and B. Nonnon, customer living at 50 St. Louis Street, New Orleans. Nonnon agrees to travel to Paris, France and produce costumes, masks, wigs and etc. according to the designs provided by the Memphi. Nonnon agrees to pay particular attention to designs numbered 16, 17, 18, 22, 95, and 96 and produce authentic replicas; costumes to include a Knight with copper armour; King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella; King Boabdil in armour with jewels; masks and wigs to represent Grant, DeSoto and Columbus; a dragon, an alligator, a serpent, an octupus, and three large decorated shells. Nonnon agrees to produce ninety-six other costumes according to numbered designs. Nonnon agrees to pay for the cost of shipping and that the order will be sent by a steamship of the German line departing from LeHavre, France no later than the first week of December, 1874. Nonnon is to receive $3,840 in five installments. The contract was drawn up in triplicate at Memphis, TN.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Manuscript collection processed by John Jones
